meta.@_content: The book of the genealogy of Jesus Christ, the son of David, the son of Abraham. Abraham was the father of Isaac, and Isaac the father of Jacob, and Jacob the father of Judah and his brothers, and Ju…

The book of the genealogy of Jesus Christ, the son of David, the son of Abraham. Abraham was the father of Isaac, and Isaac the father of Jacob, and Jacob the father of Judah and his brothers, and Ju…

a.@_title: Or is (three times in verse 11; also verse 14)
Hebrew any who wakes and answers
Or And not one has done this who has a portion of the Spirit. And what was that one seeking?
Or So take care; also verse 16
Probable meaning (compare Septuagint and Deuteronomy 24:1–4); or “The Lord, the God of Israel, says that he hates divorce, and him who covers
Or and they will belong to the Lord, bringers of an offering in righteousness
Probably a name for some crop-destroying pest or pests

a.@_data-passage: Psalm 84:11; Luke 1:78; John 1:4; John 8:12; John 9:5; John 12:46

a.@_title: The Hebrew term rendered decree of utter destruction refers to things devoted (or set apart) to the Lord (or by the Lord) for destruction

a.@_data-passage: 2 Samuel 7:12–16; Psalm 132:11; Isaiah 11:1; Jeremiah 23:5; Luke 1:32; Luke 1:69; John 7:42; Acts 2:30; Acts 13:23; Romans 1:3; 2 Timothy 2:8; Revelation 22:16

a.@_title: Asaph is probably an alternate spelling of Asa; some manuscripts Asa; also verse 8
Amos is probably an alternate spelling of Amon; some manuscripts Amon; twice in this verse

a.@_data-passage: Matthew 2:4; Matthew 11:2; Matthew 16:16; Matthew 22:42; Matthew 23:10; Mark 8:29; Luke 3:15; John 1:41; John 4:25

a.@_title: That is, legally pledged to be married

a.@_data-passage: Luke 2:11; Acts 4:12; Acts 5:31; Acts 13:23; Acts 13:38; Acts 3:26

div.em: More voices will be available soon

p.#text: is an award-winning singer-songwriter. Her voice is synonymous with hymns, having founded, along with her husband, Keith, the Getty Music Organization, which helps people learn the Bible through hymns to carry for life. Kristyn performs annual shows at Carnegie Hall, the Kennedy Center, and the Grand Ole Opry, where she leads the Sing! conference—based on her book by the same name. She is particularly passionate about helping children and families learn their faith through song. Kristyn and Keith are originally from Northern Ireland and now live in Nashville, Tennessee, with their four daughters.

(1952–2022) was a narrator who worked on over 140 audiobooks. Heath worked in radio and theater for thirty-five years, including voicing characters for computer games and television, narrating a radio program for kids, and working as a senior member of the acting ensemble of the Lamb’s Players Theatre.
